OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states below apply

TRANSFERRED_ASSIGNED.description: The job has been transferred to the machine and assigned as current job

SET_UP_ACTIVE.description: The operator prepares the machine for the job

SET_UP_INTERRUPTED.description: The operator has interrupted but not finished the preparation of the machine for the job

SET_UP_FINISHED.description: The operator has finished the preparation of the machine for the job

START_UP_ACTIVE.description: The operator is setting the machine in the start-up phase

JOB_IN_PRODUCTION.description: The machine is producing parts/products for the job

JOB_INTERRUPTED.description: The job is interrupted. The nominal output is not reached

TEAR_DOWN_ACTIVE.description: The operator tears the machine down

TEAR_DOWN_INTERRUPTED.description: Tear-down is interrupted but not finished

FinishJob.description: With this Method the client (e.g. MES) requests the machine to change the JobStatus to JOB_FINISHED_8

InterruptJob.description: With this Method the client (e.g. MES) requests the machine to change the JobStatus to JOB_INTERRUPTED_7

StartJob.description: With this Method the client (e.g. MES) requests the machine to change the JobStatus to JOB_IN_PRODUCTION_6

BoxId.description: Id of the box in which the current production is put in

CurrentLotName.description: Name of the current production lot

ResetAverageCycleTime.description: Initiates a new calculation of the average cycle time for the job

ResetBoxCounters.description: Setting the cycle and parts counters for the current box to 0

ResetJobCounters.description: Setting the cycle and parts counters for the job to 0

StopAtCycleEnd.description: Directs the machine to stop at the end of the current cycle

BoxBadPartsCounter.description: Number of bad parts produced in the current box

BoxCycleCounter.description: Number of finished cycles for the current box

BoxGoodPartsCounter.description: Number of good parts produced in the current box

BoxPartsCounter.description: Total number of parts produced in the current box

BoxTestSamplesCounter.description: Number of test sample parts produced in the current box

JobBadPartsCounter.description: Number of bad parts produced in the current job

JobCycleCounter.description: Number of finished cycles in the job

JobGoodPartsCounter.description: Number of good parts produced in the current job

JobPartsCounter.description: Total number of parts produced in the current job

JobTestSamplesCounter.description: Number of test sample parts produced in the current job

LastCycleTime.description: Time of the recently finished cycle

LastPartId.description: Id(s) of the parts produced in the recently finished cycle

MachineCycleCounter.description: Number of finished cycles in the machine life time

data.description: Average cycle time
Number of bad parts produced in the current box
Number of finished cycles for the current box
Number of good parts produced in the current box
Total number of parts produced in the current box
Number of test sample parts produced in the current box
Number of bad parts produced in the current job
Number of finished cycles in the job
Number of good parts produced in the current job
Total number of parts produced in the current job
Number of test sample parts produced in the current job
Time of the recently finished cycle
Id(s) of the parts produced in the recently finished cycle
Number of finished cycles in the machine life time

HelpText.description: Text with additional information for the operator

IsStandstillMessage.description: Indication if the message has led to a standstill

CavityCycleQualityEnumeration.description: Quality of the cycle for each cavity

NO_PART.description: There is no part in cavity

GOOD_PART.description: The machine has detected no failures during the cycle for this cavity and the part quality is assumed as good

BAD_PART.description: The machine has detected failures during the cycle for the cavity and the part quality is assumed as bad

REWORK.description: The machine has detected failures during the cycle for the cavity which might be fixed by reworking the part

GOOD_CYCLE.description: The machine has detected no failures during the cycle and the part quality (for all cavities) is assumed as good

BAD_CYCLE.description: The quality of the part(s) is assumed as bad

TEST_SAMPLE_CYCLE.description: A cycle is separated as a test sample

FAILED_CYCLE.description: The machine has detected failures during the cycle and the part quality is assumed as bad. Further information is provided by the MessageCondition fired in this case.

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states below apply

TRANSFERRED_ASSIGNED.description: The job has been transferred to the machine and assigned as current job

SET_UP_ACTIVE.description: The operator prepares the machine for the job

SET_UP_INTERRUPTED.description: The operator has interrupted but not finished the preparation of the machine for the job

SET_UP_FINISHED.description: The operator has finished the preparation of the machine for the job

START_UP_ACTIVE.description: The operator is setting the machine in the start-up phase

JOB_IN_PRODUCTION.description: The machine is producing parts/products for the job

JOB_INTERRUPTED.description: The job is interrupted. The nominal output is not reached

TEAR_DOWN_ACTIVE.description: The operator tears the machine down

TEAR_DOWN_INTERRUPTED.description: Tear-down is interrupted but not finished

BoxBadPartsCounter.description: Number of bad parts produced in the current box

BoxGoodPartsCounter.description: Number of good parts produced in the current box

BoxId.description: Id of the box in which the current production is put in

BoxPartsCounter.description: Total number of  parts produced in the current box

BoxTestSamplesCounter.description: Number of test sample parts produced in the current box

CavityCycleQuality.description: Quality of the cycle for each cavity

CurrentLotName.description: Name of the current production lot

JobBadPartsCounter.description: Number of bad parts produced in the current job

JobCycleCounter.description: Number of the cycle in the job

JobGoodPartsCounter.description: Number of good parts produced in the current job

JobPartsCounter.description: Total number of parts produced in the current job

JobTestSamplesCounter.description: Number of test sample parts produced in the current job

MachineCycleCounter.description: Number of finished cycles in the machine life time

PartId.description: Id(s) of the parts produced in the cycle

ACTIVE_ERROR_DETECTED.description: Diagnostics active, at least one error detected

COMPLETE.description: Diagnostics completed successfully, result in variable Result available

MACHINE.description: The machine causes the event (e.g. an alarm)

OPERATOR.description: The operator of the machine causes the event (e.g. a parameter change)

MES.description: The MES causes the event (e.g. a MESMessage)

PERIPHERAL_DEVICE.description: A peripheral device causes the event (e.g. an alarm)

JobCycleCounter.description: Current value of JobCycleCounter in the ActiveJobValues Object when the event is fired. Only to be used for cyclic production

CardUid.description: Uid of the identification card used by the operator for logging in to the machine

IsPresent.description: The machine can have instances for the maximum number of users that can be simultaneously logged in. TRUE if the instance of UserType represents a user that is currently logged in.

Language.description: Currently selected language on the machine control unit

MachineModeEnumeration.description: Current machine mode (as defined by mode selector on the machine)

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states apply

AUTOMATIC.description: The machine is in automatic mode

SEMI_AUTOMATIC.description: The machine is in semi-automatic mode

MANUAL.description: The machine is in manual mode

SETUP.description: The machine is in setup mode

SLEEP.description: The machine is in sleep mode. Machine is still switched on, energy consumption reduced by e.g. reducing heating, switching drives off. Production is not possible.

IsStandstillMessage.description: Indication if the message has led to a standstill

NewValue.description: New value of the changed parameter

NewValueUnit.title: EUInformation
NewValueUnit.description: New unit of the changed parameter

OldValue.description: Old value of the changed parameter

OldValueUnit.title: EUInformation
OldValueUnit.description: Old unit of the changed parameter

NewValue.description: Information if the production dataset is now locked

OldValue.description: Information if the production dataset was locked

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states below apply

NO_PRODUCTION.description: The machine does not produce any parts/products

START_UP.description: The machine is producing parts/products in the start-up phase. So the correct settings of the machines are not reached.

READY_FOR_PRODUCTION.description: The machine is producing parts/products, the correct settings of the machines are reached but the production is not yet released (e.g. waiting for release from quality assurance)

PRODUCTION.description: The machine is producing parts/products.  In semi-automatic mode also during waiting time (e.g. for manual loading/unloading of parts) ProductionStatus remains in this state (time out possible if e.g. cycle time exceeds a pre-defined limit)

DRY_RUN.description: The machine is moving without material

UserChangeEnumeration.description: Information if a user logs in or off

LOG_ON.description: The user has logged on the machine

LOG_OFF.description: The user has logged off the machine

Origin.description: Information about the origin of the remote access

RemoteUserName.description: Name of the remote user (e.g. name of the service employee doing remote service)

UserChange.title: UserChangeEnumeration
UserChange.description: Information if the user logs in or off

UPDATE.description: The sequence has been updated (e.g. when a new production dataset has been activated)

ADD.description: An element has been added to the sequence

MODIFY.description: An element of the sequence has been modified

MOVE.description: An element of the sequence has been moved

DELETE.description: An element of the sequence has been deleted

UserChangeEnumeration.description: Information if a user logs in or off

LOG_ON.description: The user has logged on the machine

LOG_OFF.description: The user has logged off the machine

UserChange.title: UserChangeEnumeration
UserChange.description: Information if the user logs in or off

MouldId.description: Id of the mould for which the available production datasets are requested

NameFilter.description: Filtering the list of production datasets by name

StorageEnumeration.description: Indication which parts of the production dataset shall be activated in the machine control after writing

PRODUCTION.description: The production dataset is written directly to the (active layer of the) control system of the machine

PREPARATION.description: The production dataset is written to the preparation layer of the control system of the machine (if supported)

FILE_SYSTEM.description: The production dataset is written to the file system of the machine for later activation

Name.description: Name of the production dataset that should be transferred from the server to the client

Storage.title: StorageEnumeration
Storage.description: Indication from where the dataset is read

StorageEnumeration.description: Indication which parts of the production dataset shall be activated in the machine control after writing

PRODUCTION.description: The production dataset is written directly to the (active layer of the) control system of the machine

PREPARATION.description: The production dataset is written to the preparation layer of the control system of the machine (if supported)

FILE_SYSTEM.description: The production dataset is written to the file system of the machine for later activation

Components.description: Array which indicates which parts of the production dataset shall be activated in the machine control after writing

Name.description: Name of the production dataset that should be transferred from the client to the server

Storage.title: StorageEnumeration
Storage.description: Indication where the dataset is written to

AutoTuningOff.description: Stops an already active self-optimisation process (no control parameters are changed)

AutoTuningOn.description: Starts the self-optimisation of the controller

AutomaticControllerMode.description: Determination if PID Parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

AutoTuningActive.description: Informs if the automatic tuning is currently active

PIDParameters.description: PID Parameters as array if several input signals (sensors) are used for the control

items.title: PIDParametersDataType
items.description: Structure for storing the parameters of a PID controller

ACTIVE_ERROR_DETECTED.description: Diagnostics active, at least one error detected

COMPLETE.description: Diagnostics completed successfully, result in variable Result available

ControlModeEnumeration.description: Indication how the parameter is currently controlled

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states below apply

STANDBY.description: Parameter is controlled to stand by value

ONLY_MEASUREMENT.description: The sensors deliver the current value but there is no controlling

SetRampDown.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetRampUp.description: Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

data.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time
Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

ResetMonitoring.description: With this method the tolerance values are set according to the actual value and the set monitoring sensitivity

ActualValue.description: Actual value of the monitored parameter

AlarmSuppression.description: The start-up alarm suppression deactivates alarms of a monitored parameter during start up or a setpoint jump

AutomaticMonitoring.description: Determination if monitoring tolerance parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

LowerTolerance.description: Lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter

LowerTolerance2.description: Second lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter

MaxValue.description: Maximum absolute value of the process parameter

MinValue.description: Minimum absolute value of the process parameter

MonitoringSensitivity.description: Defines how closely the tolerances are set during the automatic limit setting

SetRampDown.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetRampUp.description: Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetValue.description: Set/nominal/target value of the monitored parameter

Status.description: Information if the ActualValue is within the tolerances or has passed a tolerance or min/max value

UpperTolerance.description: Upper relative tolerance value of the process parameter

UpperTolerance2.description: Second upper relative tolerance value of the process parameter

data.description: Actual value of the monitored parameter

NOT_DUE.description: Maintenance of the device/component is not due

WARNING.description: Maintenance of the device/component is due in the near future

DUE.description: Maintenance of the device/component is due

Reset.description: This Method sets the RemainingInterval to Interval and Status to NOT_DUE_0

AdditionalInformation.description: Additional information on the necessary maintenance. Can be also a link to another document.

RemainingInterval.description: Interval before next maintenance is due

Status.title: MaintenanceStatusEnumeration
Status.description: Maintenance status of the machine/device/component (represented by the parent element)

TotalOperation.description: How long is the component running in total

data.description: Regular interval between two maintenances
Interval before next maintenance is due
How long is the component running in total

ContinueAtJobEnd.description: Indication if the machine continues the production even if the nominal output has been reached

CustomerName.description: Name of the customer for that the job is produced

Material.description: Array of material names used for the job

ProductDescription.description: Array of descriptions of the products produced by the job

ProductionDatasetDescription.description: Additional description of the production dataset which is needed for the job

ProductionDatasetName.description: Name of the production dataset which is needed for the job

ProductName.description: Array of product names produced by the job

SetCyclicJobData.description: Method for setting the data for cyclic jobs

ExpectedCycleTime.description: Calculated cycle time for the job

MouldId.description: Id of the Mould used for the job

NominalBoxParts.description: Number of parts that shall be put into one box

NominalParts.description: Total number (sum of all cavities) of parts that shall be produced by the job

NumCavities.description: Number of cavities in the Mould used for production

SendCyclicJobList.description: Sends a list of jobs for cyclic processes available on the client to the server

items.title: CyclicJobListElementType
items.description: Description of a job in a cyclic job list

NominalParts.description: Total number (sum of all cavities) of parts that shall be produced by the job

NominalBoxParts.description: Number of parts that shall be put into one box

ExpectedCycleTime.description: Calculated cycle time for the job

MouldId.description: Id of the mould used for the job

NumCavities.description: Number of cavities in the mould used for production

SendJobList.description: Sends a list of jobs available on the client to the server

items.title: JobListElementType
items.description: Description of a job in a job list

CustomerName.description: Name of the cumstomer for that the job is produced

ProductionDatasetName.description: Name of the production dataset which is needed for the job

ProductionDatasetDescription.description: Additional description of the production dataset which is needed for the job

Material.description: Array of material names used for the job

ProductName.description: Array of product names produced by the job

ProductDescription.description: Array of descriptions of the products produced by the job

GetCurrentPage.description: Method for retrieving a screenshot of the control system with the currently shown contents

GetPage.description: Method for retrieving the image of a page of the control system

SetMachineTime.description: Method for setting the server time together with TimeZoneOffset

LocationName.description: Description of the location of the machine given by the machine operator or OPC client

PageDirectory.description: List of the pages that are implemented in the machine control system and are shown on the screen of the machine

items.title: PageEntryDataType
items.description: Information on a page that is implemented in the machine control system and shown on the screen of the machine

TimeZoneOffset.title: TimeZoneDataType
TimeZoneOffset.description: Difference of the local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) given by the machine operator or OPC client

UserMachineName.description: Description of the machine given by the machine operator or OPC client

MESUrl.description: URL to display a webpage generated by the MES in a web browser integrated in the machine

StandstillReasons.description: List of the standstill reasons from which one is selected by the operator in the case of a standstill

LockedByMES.description: LockedByMES means that this StandstillReason has been set or modified by the MES and so this may not be changed by the machine

StandstillReasonsLockedByMES.description: Indication if the list StandstillReasons has been modified by the MES and may not be changed by the machine

StandstillReasonId.description: Id of the StandstillReason set by the operator after a standstill occurs

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states below apply

NO_PRODUCTION.description: The machine does not produce any parts/products

START_UP.description: The machine is producing parts/products in the start-up phase. So the correct settings of the machines are not reached.

READY_FOR_PRODUCTION.description: The machine is producing parts/products, the correct settings of the machines are reached but the production is not yet released (e.g. waiting for release from quality assurance)

PRODUCTION.description: The machine is producing parts/products.  In semi-automatic mode also during waiting time (e.g. for manual loading/unloading of parts) ProductionStatus remains in this state (time out possible if e.g. cycle time exceeds a pre-defined limit)

DRY_RUN.description: The machine is moving without material

DisableAutomaticRun.description: Method for disabling the semi-automatic and automatic run of the machine

EnableAutomaticRun.description: Method for enabling the semi-automatic and automatic run of the machine

RequestTestSample.description: The machine shall separate a test sample (e.g. for quality check). The size of the test sample depends on the product/machine configuration.

ResetWatchDog.description: Setting the watch dog timer to the value set by the last calling of SetWatchDogTime

SetWatchDogTime.description: Release of production for a given time

ProductionStatus.title: ProductionStatusEnumeration
ProductionStatus.description: Production status when the machine is in automatic or semi-automatic mode

MachineModeEnumeration.description: Current machine mode (as defined by mode selector on the machine)

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states apply

AUTOMATIC.description: The machine is in automatic mode

SEMI_AUTOMATIC.description: The machine is in semi-automatic mode

MANUAL.description: The machine is in manual mode

SETUP.description: The machine is in setup mode

SLEEP.description: The machine is in sleep mode. Machine is still switched on, energy consumption reduced by e.g. reducing heating, switching drives off. Production is not possible.

ActivateSleepMode.description: Method for activation of sleep mode

DeactivateSleepMode.description: Method for deactivation of sleep mode

IsPresent.description: Indication if the machine is physically present and connected

MachineMode.description: Current machine mode (as defined by mode selector on the machine)

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states below apply

MOULD_NOT_INSTALLED.description: The mould is not installed on the machine

MOULD_CHANGE.description: During installation or changing of the mould

MOULD_INSTALLED.description: The mould is installed and ready for production

IsPresent.description: Indication if the mould is physically present and connected

HEATING.description: The zone is a heating zone

COOLING.description: The zone is a cooling zone

TEMPERATURE_CONTROL.description: The zone is controlled by a temperature control device

HOT_RUNNER.description: The zone is a hot runner zone

MEASURING.description: The zone has no heating or cooling, Only the temperature is measured.

ControlModeEnumeration.description: Indication how the parameter is currently controlled

STANDBY.description: Parameter is controlled to stand by value

ONLY_MEASUREMENT.description: The sensors deliver the current value but there is no controlling

ControlMode.title: ControlModeEnumeration
ControlMode.description: Indication how the temperature is currently controlled

HighDeviationTemperature1.description: Maximum temperature that is in the normal tolerance. A higher actual value may create a warning. Used for quality control. Relative value.

HighDeviationTemperature2.description: Maximum tolerable temperature. A higher actual value may create an alarm. Relative value.

IsPresent.description: Indication if the temperature zone is physically present and connected

LowDeviationTemperature1.description: Minimum temperature that is in the normal tolerance. A lower actual value may create a warning. Used for quality control. Relative value.

LowDeviationTemperature2.description: Minimum tolerable temperature. A lower actual value may create an alarm. Relative value.

data.description: Current temperature of the zone
Maximum temperature that is in the normal tolerance. A higher actual value may create a warning. Used for quality control. Relative value.
Maximum tolerable temperature. A higher actual value may create an alarm. Relative value.
Minimum temperature that is in the normal tolerance. A lower actual value may create a warning. Used for quality control. Relative value.
Minimum tolerable temperature. A lower actual value may create an alarm. Relative value.
Nominal temperature (absolute value)
Standby temperature of the zone

IsPresent.description: Indication if the power unit is physically present and connected

PowerOn.description: Indication if the PowerUnit is switched on

data.description: Current temperature of the PowerUnit

ActualPressure.description: Current pressure of the hydraulic unit
